cards.rules_text:
Vigilance
When Sparkworker enters, if you control another artifact, you may put +1/+1 counter on this creature. If you do, you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Sparkworkers were made as a response to try and remake Azure technology. It failed, however these drones are very useful in manufacturing actually useful drones for combat.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Flash
When Frontline Fodder dies, choose one — 
• You gain 2 life.
• Create a tapped Junk token. [i](It's an artifact with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Exile the top card of your library. You may play that card this turn. Activate only as a sorcery.”)[/i]

Lifelink
Whenever you gain life, Order Priest gains +1/+0 until end of turn.
[i]Channel[/i] — {1}{B}, Discard Order Priest: Target creature you don't control gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Remember, if i say that Rumi is sinful, you get paid... But is that really ethical?”[/i]

cards.rules_text: When Drudging Mechanist enters, create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“The Azures keep trying to find ways around our protection systems. it is my job to create distractions for them.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: When Oppressive Enforcer enters or attacks, you may tap target creature. If that creature is modified, it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Keeping the people silent and happy is paving the way to win the war on our homeland.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Vigilance
Bronze-Halo Aspirant gains first strike when it attacks as long as its equipped.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Just following orders, sir. There's no reason to be afraid when the order is here to protect you from the syndicate.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Vigilance
Whenever another creature you control enters, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“I need to keep these people in line and make sure they don't wander off to go get killed by Azures.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Flash
Flying
When this creature enters during an opponents turn, target creature you control gains indestructible until end of turn.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Fly low, fly fast. If your not sending enough soldiers, you're not helping enough.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: When Field Medic Veteran enters, you may return target creature card with mana value 2 or less from your graveyard to your hand. If you do, you gain 1 life.

When Halberd-Line Enforcer enters, you may attach an equipment you control to it.
Halberd-Line Enforcer gains +1/+0 for each equipment attached to it.

Rushdown Sergeant has first strike while its attacking.
When Rushdown Sergeant enters, creatures you control gain +1/+1 and vigilance until end of turn.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Even the order has robotic leaders on its side.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: Target attacking or blocking gets -3/-0 until end of turn. Then if that creature's power is 2 or less, destroy it.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Its simply what had to be done. We can't have more people supporting the syndicate.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Enchant permanent
As long as enchanted permanent is a creature, it can't attack or block.
As long as enchanted permanent is an artifact, it cannot activate activated abilities except for mana abilities.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Put the entire area on lockdown. We have confirmed double agents in here.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Exile target tapped creature.
If that creature had power 4 or greater, you gain 4 life.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“If it moved, it's dead. If it hit you, that's a bonus.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Choose one —
• Target creature you control gets +1/+2 until end of turn.
• Return target creature you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Gotta abandon Venthir.. I need to go off the Grid...”[/i]
[i]Even the highest officers sometimes use the recruit weapons. they're simple and effective.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Creatures you control get +1/+2 until end of turn. If you control three or more creatures with different powers, create a 1/1 white Human creature token.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“We were told to wait. We didn't.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. If you control an artifact, draw a card.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“The order elites like to play with their food before destroying it completely and repurposing it for something else.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Flying
When Glitchphaser enters, if you control another artifact, you may put a +1/+1 counter on this creature. If you do, surveil 2.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Glitchphasers are used as intelligence drones by both the Order and the Syndicate. they're easy to build, and easy to replace.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: Whenever you tap an artifact for mana, Data Skimmer gets +1/+0 and has flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Lightweight, agile, and invisible to most surveillance. Its simply the best siphon.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
When Scrap-Node Hermit enters, mill two cards. Then if an artifact card was milled this way, draw a card.
{T}, Mill a card: Add {C}.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“They think I'm junking for parts. I'm listening to the deconstructed.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Flash
When Neuroline Coder enters, Compile 2, then you you may cast a instant initialized card you own from exile. [i](To Compile 2, look at the top two cards of your library. You may exile one face down initialized, then put the rest on the bottom of your library.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Memory is a sandbox. Hack it right, and you can run anything.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Whenever you cast a spell, if {C} was spent to cast it, Predictive Patternist gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
[i]Channel[/i] — {G}, Discard Predictive Patternist: Compile 2. [i](Look at the top two cards of your library. You may exile one face down initialized, then put the rest on the bottom of your library.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Prediction models hold when emotion doesn't.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Flash
When Latency Disruptor enters, tap up to one target creature, then put a stun counter on it.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Target's latency multiplied sixfold. Engagement window achieved.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
When Chassis Salvager enters, return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
{T}: Add {C}. Activate only if you control an artifact.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Please keep it down, I'm busy trying to fix this piece.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Flying
When Covert Compiler enters, Compile 2. Then if you own four or more initialized cards, put a +1/+1 counter on Covert Compiler. [i](To Compile 2, look at the top two cards of your library. You may exile one face down initialized, then put the rest on the bottom of your library.)[/i]

Defender
When Deep-Vault Watcher enters, surveil 2.
[i]Descend 7[/i] — As long as there are seven or more permanent cards in your graveyard, Deep-Vault Watcher can attack as though it didn't have defender.

Counter target spell.
If {C} was spent to cast this spell, Draw a card.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“No more fighting. Just silence.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {2}. If you do, choose one — 
• [i]Make it Open Source: [/i]Compile 1. [i](Look at the top card of your library. You may exile that card facedown initialized. If you dont, put it on the bottom of your library.)[/i]
• [i]Keep it Closed Source: [/i]Surveil 2.

Enchant creature
When System Freeze enters, surveil 1. [i](Look at the top card of your library. You may put it into your graveyard.)[/i]
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“He stared in awe. This wasnt what he was expecting at all. His mind slowed to a halt.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Draw two cards.
[i]Metalcraft[/i] — If you control three or more artifacts, draw three cards instead.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Perfect, that means its overloaded.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Kicker {C} [i](You may pay an additional {C} as you cast this spell.)[/i]
If {C} was spent to pay the mana cost of this spell, surveil 3.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Input null. Output three.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Return target nonland permanent you don't control to its owner's hand. 
Compile 2. [i](Look at the top two cards of your library. You may exile one face down initialized, then put the rest on the bottom of your library.)[/i]
Target creature gets +2/+0 and gains “When this creature deals combat damage to a player, draw a card” until end of turn. If that creature is an artifact, it also gains flying.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Inject velocity. Prioritize data retrieval.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Tap up to two target creatures.
[i]Metalcraft[/i] — If you control three or more artifacts, you may put a stun counter on up to one of those creatures.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“It's not about breaking the brain. It's about silencing its patterns.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Deathtouch
When Bonecacher enters, if you control another artifact, you may put a +1/+1 counter on this creature. If you do, return up to two artifact creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Eventually, Order scavengers and Syndicate scrappers find them, and theyre scrapped for sparkworker parts, only leaving a husk of the former drone.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
When Sparkscour Hacker dies, you draw a card and lose 1 life.
[i]Channel[/i] — {1}{W}, Discard Sparkscour Hacker: Destroy target noncreature artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Every firewall's got a pressure point, you just gotta either bleed or pay for it.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: When this creature enters, target opponent discards a card.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“No warning, no questions. Just punishment for the undeserving.” — Rumi.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
When Memory-Gutter Scraper enters, mill two cards.
Whenever you mill one or more cards, if two or more artifact cards were milled that way, create a 1/1 colorless artifact Servo creature token.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“The memories they discard? We refine them into weapons.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Menace
When Processor Salvager dies, you may recycle. If you exile three or more cards this way, create a Junk token. [i](Exile one or more cards from your graveyard. Draw a card if you exile 5 or more cards this way.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]“They think decay is the end. We know it's just stage two.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Lifelink
When Hierarch Enforcer enters, put an oppressed role on target creature you control and target creature you don't control. [i](If you control another Role on it, put that one into the graveyard. Enchanted creature is 1/1 and is a Citizen in addition to its other types.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Mercy is for the obedient. For the rest, we bring justice.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: Whenever you sacrifice another permanent, Bloodcircuit Marauder gets +1/+0 until end of turn and and can't be blocked this turn.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“The Order doesn't waste. Everything burns for data, even us. But that's just a normal Tuesday.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Flying
When Projection Spiritcaller enters, surveil 3. [i](Look at the top three cards of your library, then put any number of them into your graveyard and the rest on top of your library in any order.)[/i]

When Lobeharvester Drone enters or attacks, you may recycle. If you recycled three or more cards this way, create a tapped Junk token. [i](Exile one or more cards from your graveyard. Draw a card if you exile 5 or more cards this way.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Strip the cortex. Melt the bones. Leave the rest for the ground.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Menace
When Order Elite Juggernaut enters, each player creates two Oppressed Role tokens attached to two different creatures they control. [i](If you control another Role on it, put that one into the graveyard. Enchanted creature is 1/1 and is a Citizen in addition to its other types.)[/i]
Destroy target creature or planeswalker. If it was a artifact, each opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“The double agents never saw it coming.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: Destroy target creature with mana value 3 or less.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Sometimes, just removing the defective Azure is more effective than trying to scrap it for parts.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: Each player sacrifices a creature of their choice. If they can't, they discard a card. Draw a card. You lose 2 life.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“They go in, destroy everything, then apprehend anyone inside, and probably keep some stuff for themselves.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn. If it's an artifact creature, instead it gets -4/-4 until end of turn.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“One cut, and the machine's lifeline runs cold.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: If you control an artifact, surveil 2. Target player draws two cards and lose 2 life. [i](To surveil 2, look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them into your graveyard and the rest on top of your library in any order.)[/i]
Recycle, then return target creature card exiled this way to your hand. [i](Exile one or more cards from your graveyard. Draw a card if you exile 5 or more cards this way.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Old frames, new code. Strip away the weaker to create the stronger.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“The order demands your submission to it. Otherwise, they make you beg.”[/i]

Enchant creature

cards.flavor_text: [i]“Even the weakest of fighters can be turned into killing machines with the right upgrades.”[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]“Training under Kakeru is tiring but rewording work. I mean.. i get to learn how to make my own saws!”[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]“The Scorchlink will do anything for information.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: Gain control of target artifact or creature until end of turn. Untap it. It gains haste until end of turn. You may sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step. If you do, Logic Corruption deals 2 damage to target player.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“If a logic core is damaged, Azures can temporarily fight for us with some decent reprogramming.”[/i]
